stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è Tuesday Night Trollball: The Siege of the Yard! üéôÔ∏è

Well hello there, sports fans! Nok the Corrupter here, coming to you live and loud from the graffiti-smeared, concrete-cracking glory of The Unruly Yard! üèüÔ∏è We are at the absolute fever pitch of the Losers Bracket, and boy oh boy, the air is thick with the scent of desperation and the city's finest hot gravy! It is Game Four of this high-stakes Best of Five series! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures are currently leading the series 2-1 against those squeaky-clean Haven Lights. If the Creatures clinch it tonight, the Lights are heading home for good, and isn't that just a delightful thought? I haven't been this excited since Artorias and Morgwae broke me out of that dreary Demon Prison! ‚õìÔ∏è

The atmosphere here is positively electric! The rowdy crowd is already rattling the unstable scaffolding, and I saw a street performer trying to juggle live rats near the Haven dugout‚Äîtalk about home-field advantage! üêÄ Looking down at the pitch, the Chaos Creatures are looking mean and hungry. Lian Denton is currently chugging hot gravy from a dented tin cup‚Äînow that is a breakfast of champions! ‚òï Meanwhile, Boulanger Procto is meticulously arranging his gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral. It‚Äôs a bit strange for a rebel, but hey, whatever keeps your broadsword sharp! ‚öîÔ∏è

And what about those pristine 'heroes' from Haven? They look like they've wandered into the wrong neighborhood! Tybi Reo is currently drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head in the dirt. üé® I hope her play is better than her art, because the Creatures are looking to make some anatomically incorrect adjustments to her face! Zwart Bunns is whispering secret fears to the Trollball again‚ÄîI hope he told it he's afraid of losing, because that‚Äôs exactly what‚Äôs on the menu! We‚Äôve got an open bar, the Twinlights are blocked out by the city smog, and the brutality is about to begin! Let‚Äôs get to the Trollball! üç∫üí•
postGame:
# üèÜ Rebellion Rules! Haven Lights Snuffed Out! üèÜ

Holy Mackerel, what a glorious display of bone-snapping beauty! Nok the Corrupter here, and my horns are still buzzing from the absolute carnage we witnessed at The Unruly Yard! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have defended their turf with a grit-your-teeth 3 to 2 victory over the Haven Lights, officially winning the series 3 games to 1! üèÜ Those 'heroes' from Haven are headed back to their library to cry in their books, while the Creatures march on! It was a masterpiece of mayhem where the 'virtue' of Haven was trampled under the muddy boots of rebellion! üèüÔ∏è‚ùå

The action started with a shock to the system! Riffle Heyde of the Lights decided he wasn't going down without a fight, launching a magnificent shoot from center field that went right through the basket! üéØ Two points for the Lights! The Unruly Yard went silent for a microsecond before the booing reached a level that probably rattled the windows in the Temple of Light! ‚õ™ It was a brave start, but as we know, the higher they climb, the harder they fall onto the concrete! üß±

But the Lights' early lead didn't stop them from playing dirty! Riffle Heyde went on an absolute rampage, proving that even a mace-wielding saint can have a mean streak! He tackled Wolbrom Ariella so hard it sent him straight to the infirmary! üöë Not satisfied with one casualty, Coward Tarton then leveled Fogel Raynold, leaving him counting the graffiti tags on the walls! I love the consistency, folks‚Äîif you aren't bleeding, you aren't trying! ü©∏

The middle of the game was a total defensive grind. Mouldon Earl and Tucker Hett tried to break through for the Creatures, but the Haven defense was stickier than a warlock‚Äôs bar tab! üçπ Wieren Ivar and Dickenson Beker were blocking like their lives depended on it‚Äîand in this district, they probably did! The open bar was clearly starting to affect the aim, as passes were flying wilder than a fey on moon-dust! üßö‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Just before the break, Riffle Heyde struck again, injuring Tucker Hett! ü§ï It was a systematic dismantling of the Monteforte roster. Honestly, Riffle Harrington‚Äîthe Haven healer‚Äîshould be given a medal for the amount of work he *didn't* have to do because his teammates were doing all the hurting! But you can't keep a good Chaos Creature down, especially when they‚Äôre fueled by spite and hot gravy! ‚òï

By the time we hit Overtime, the atmosphere was thick with ale and adrenaline. The street performers were doing backflips over the injured, and the rowdy crowd was halfway through a riot! üé™ That‚Äôs when the momentum shifted! The Creatures found their second wind (or maybe it was just the ritual sangria kicking in). They locked down the field, making sure the Lights couldn't move an inch without meeting a billhook or a seax! üî®

Then came the moment of glory! Boulanger Procto, the man with the spiral gear, decided it was time to end the Havenites' season. He snagged the ball, dodged a desperate lunge from the defense, and sprinted into the end zone for a thunderous dunk! üèÄ The crowd erupted, the shaky scaffolding swayed, and the Creatures took the lead! It was a beautiful sight, the kind of play that would make Dima the shadow king nod in silent approval! üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

The final minutes were a blur of desperation for the Lights. Placido Kora and Raouf Dragone were like a brick wall in center field. Every time a Haven player tried to advance, they were met with the raw, unadulterated chaos of New Monteforte! üß± I bet even Sir Artorias is embarrassed to be associated with such a lack of coordination from his 'holy' proteges! They were stumbling around like they‚Äôd been hit by a confusion spell from Morgwae himself! üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

The drunkenness was certainly a factor by the end! I saw Farand Keil trying to whip a street performer instead of the ball carrier, and Shiroma Salim was re-taping his shield handle for the hundredth time while the game passed him by! üõ°Ô∏è The Lights were flickering, and the Creatures were ready to blow them out for good! It was a total failure for the virtuous team in a very unvirtuous backyard! üïØÔ∏èüëé

As the final whistle blew, the Unruly Yard turned into a sea of madness! The Chaos Creatures have clinched the series 3-1, sending the Haven Lights packing! üèÜ Dame Terra Monteforte must be cackling in her dirt-throne tonight, because her rebels just showed the world that light doesn't always win in the shadows of the city! I haven't seen the Haven fans this quiet since the last time they were told Sir Tanos was in charge of the maps! üå≤üó∫Ô∏è

Final score: New Monteforte Chaos Creatures 3, Haven Lights 2! The Creatures move forward in the Losers Bracket, and the Lights are officially extinguished! üïØÔ∏è‚ùå I‚Äôm going to go find where Lian Denton keeps that gravy and see if I can mix it with some of Imra‚Äôs special dust! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the most beautiful disaster in Osterra! Stay brutal, stay bloody, and keep your healers on speed-dial! üéôÔ∏èüòà
